description: Primer on digital audio. Overview of signal processing, sampling, compression, human psychoacoustics, MP3, intellectual property, hardware and software platform components, and networking (i.e., the basic technical underpinnings of modern MP3 players and cell phones).
name: DIG AUDIO BASICS

values.comments:
The course provides an overview of signal processing, sampling, compression, human psychoacoustics, MP3, intellectual property, hardware and software platform components, and networking (i.e., the basic technical underpinnings of modern MP3 players and cell phones).

This course provides an introduction to digital audio.  Students stated that they wished they learned more applicable engineering knowledge in class. However, students noted that lab techniques learned were useful.
Students wished that TA’s were more prepared to help during the TA-run lab portions. Students wished that assignments were graded in a timelier manner, especially lab reports. No students commented on the teaching ability of the professor.

This class is intended for sophomores in Electrical Engineering. Students reported that while workload wasn’t too intense, the grading, especially for labs were harsh.

This review was based on comments that 8 students submitted.
